text.tspan: The ability to go back a step from the Greeter to the
Tails boot dialog allows people the freedom to change
their mind, once they arrive at the Greeter, and go back
and boot into either Failsafe or Normal Tails, whichever
is the opposite of the one they just booted.
This approach is only really appropriate in this one case.
An alternative to the Close[x] is the Back[<<]. However,
this may not be more appropriate since the Back[<<]
suggests that the previous content was contained
within the same Greeter dialog window, which is not

g.text: These are your DEFAULT configuration settings.
These are your DEFAULT configuration settings.

text.tspan: Presuming that there is a technical limitation to return
ing
back to the Tails boot dialog, it seems most appro
priate to not permit people to close the Greeter. This
presumption is based on the post-modern loading
screen that communicates through time and visual
separation that unloading a Tails mode and returning to
the Tails boot dialog is not possible.
There is currently no way to return to the Tails boot
dialog; this approach wouldnâ€™t change that.
